text.value: when i make migration it gives me this error . Error: An assembly specified in the application dependencies manifest (Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.deps.json) was not found: package: 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Runtime.win-x64', version: '8.0.6' path: 'System.Diagnostics.EventLog.Messages.dll'

This error typically occurs when there's a mismatch between the .NET runtime version installed on your machine and the version specified in your project. Here are some steps you can take to resolve this issue:
1. Check your project's target framework: Open your .csproj file and ensure that the `<TargetFramework>` element matches the version of .NET you intend to use. For example: ```xml <TargetFramework>net8.0</TargetFramework> ```
2. Verify your installed .NET SDK version: Open a command prompt or terminal and run: ``` dotnet --list-sdks ``` Make sure you have the SDK version that matches your project's target framework (in this case, 8.0.x).
3. Install the latest .NET 8.0 SDK: If you don't have the correct SDK version, download and install it from the official .NET download page: https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet/8.0
4. Update your global.json file: If you have a global.json file in your solution directory, make sure it's not forcing an older SDK version. You can update it to use the latest 8.0 version: ```json { "sdk": { "version": "8.0.100" } } ```
5. Clean and rebuild your solution: ``` dotnet clean dotnet build ```
6. Restore your project's dependencies: ``` dotnet restore ```
7. Update your project's dependencies: Make sure all your NuGet packages are up to date, especially those related to Entity Framework Core and ASP.NET Core.
8. Check for any runtime configuration issues: Ensure that your `runtimeconfig.json` file (if present) is correctly configured for .NET 8.0.
9. Verify your deployment environment: If this error occurs during deployment, make sure your deployment environment (e.g., server, Azure App Service) has the correct .NET 8.0 runtime installed.
If you've tried these steps and are still encountering the error, please provide more details about your project setup, including your .csproj file contents and the full command you're using to run the migration.
